title: How effective are TikTok misinformation debunking videos?
description: This dataset, sourced from Harvard Dataverse for the purpose of replication, contains information related to respondent demographics, political affiliation, attitudes toward specific topics, TikTok usage, and responses to specific questions relating to topics of misinformation.
citation: Bhargava, P., MacDonald, K. L., Newton, C., Lin, H., & Pennycook, G. (2023). How effective are TikTok misinformation debunking videos?. Harvard Kennedy School (HKS) Misinformation Review. https://doi.org/10.37016/mr-2020-114
keywords: content moderation, debunking, misinformation, social media, tiktok
funder: Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada, The John Templeton Foundation, Government of Canadaâ€™s Digital Citizen Contribution Program, U.S. Department of Defense
